abstract.text: Enumerates all the physics bodies in the scene that intersect a ray.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The starting point for the ray in scene coordinates.
The ending point for the ray in scene coordinates.
A block to be called for each physics body that the ray touches. The block takes the following parameters:
The physics body that the ray intersected.
body
The point in scene coordinates where the ray contacted the physics body.
point
The normal vector for the physics body at the point of contact.
normal
A pointer to a Boolean variable. Your block can set this to
to terminate the enumeration.
stop

abstract.text: Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.
An object that adds physics simulation to a node.
The driver of the physics engine in a scene; it exposes the ability for you to configure and query the physics system.
Searches for the first physics body that intersects a ray.
Searches for the first physics body that contains a point.
Searches for the first physics body that intersects the specified rectangle.
Enumerates all the physics bodies in the scene that intersect a ray.
Enumerates all the physics bodies in the scene that contain a point.
Enumerates all the physics bodies in the scene that intersect the specified rectangle.
Cast a ray to find the physics bodies in the scene that intersect it.

doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/.title: Searching the World for Physics Bodies

abstract.text: A structure that contains a point in a two-dimensional coordinate system.
A structure that contains a two-dimensional vector.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.

seeAlsoSections.title: Searching the Scene for Physics Bodies
